title: Barcelona right-back Aleix Vidal out of action for five months after suffering horrific ankle break
text:
Cruel blow Barcelona right-back Aleix Vidal out of action for five months after suffering horrific ankle break 
Spaniard went down following a challenge from the Alaves defender before being carried off on a stretcher By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments BARCELONA right-back Aleix Vidal has been ruled out of action for five months after suffering a horrific broken ankle during Barcelona’s victory over Alaves. 
The Catalan giants romped to a 6-0 victory but their win was overshadowed with Vidal’s horrendous injury with 87 minutes on the clock. EPA 
— Leo Messi (@messi10stats) February 11, 2017 
The 27-year-old went into a fairly innocuous challenge with Alaves’ Theo Hernandez but got his right ankle stuck in the turf as the slide tackle came in. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Collapsing to the floor, Vidal clutched his ankle in agony and instantly called for the medical team to come on where he was soon taken off on a stretcher. 
And Barcelona later confirmed that Vidal will be sidelined until the end of the season after taking to Twitter following the victory. 
They wrote: “Aleix Vidal will be out of action for five months.” 
It will come as a major blow for the player who was just establishing himself in Barcelona’s first-team.
